climbs.name: TRAPPIST-1
climbs.fa: TR JC Curcio, Sharon + Ken Roberts

content.description:
Thoughtful footwork moves with a balance crux. 

  Up right of vertical corner/crack to horizontal crack. Step up Right (crux) and reach to small R-facing corner above right. Finish up to cap rock which is highest point of top of cliff. 

  name? A special star. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
content.protection:
For ideas to set up Top-Rope, see the Description of this Crazy Tree sector. 

  Protection for Trad leading is unknown and likely inadequate.
content.location:
On the face just right of short low shallow right-facing corner/crack, which is L from below the cap rock which is highest point of top of cliff, or around thirty feet left from the "crazy" tree. 

  - - > See on this Photo

  . . . . or on this Photo

content.description:
Sustained thoughtful face climbing. 

  Reachy? Might be much more difficult for a climber less tall than 5ft 6inch with normal reach. 

  Start on face 4 feet right of maple tree, 8 feet left of obvious vertical crack. Roughly straight up to the top. 

  name? Fictional dwarf not in 1937 Disney movie. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

For ideas to set up Top-Rope, see the Description of this Crazy Tree sector.

content.location:
On the face to the left side of obvious vertical crack which is around thirty feet left from the "crazy" tree (and right from a maple tree). 

  - - > See on this Photo

content.description:
Thoughtful moves the whole way. 

  Up to reach the small right-facing corner. Next get established on 3.5-inch knob on top of corner. Finish over bulge up to the "higher" crazy tree. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.location:
Below small right-facing corner about twelve feet up, which is below     the higher (and thinner) "crazy" tree which is healthy growing sideways out of the top of the cliff. 

  - - > See on this Photo

content.description:
Sustained thoughtful footwork. 

  Up the face to reach horizontal crack, next diagonal up right following path of least resistance, then finish up to the higher "crazy" tree.  

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Start up the 2-foot-wide gully, finish above in short vertical groove with tiny overhang near its top -- with some weaving along the way. 

  name? Fictional dwarf 1937 Disney movie. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Sustained thoughtful face climbing, delicate moves on small holds.    If only it were longer. 

  Reachy? Might be much more difficult for a climber less tall than 5ft 6inch with normal reach. 

  Start 6-8 feet Right of obvious vertical crack, soon move left a bit. Climb w feet and hands to the right of the crack or in crack. 

  name? Fictional dwarf 1937 Disney movie. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Thoughtful face climbing. 

  Up the crack, going right of the small tree 5 ft up. 

  name? Character from famous educational puppet show (and movies) started several decades ago. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree).

content.location:
The Right of two vertical cracks on the face to the right of the R-facing corner at R edge of low big roof to right of the low big "crazy" tree and to the left of a broad nose / vague ridge. This crack starts 6 ft up at small Horizontal ledge, just R of small tree starting 5 ft up. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Variety of interesting moves at similar difficulty. 

  Move up (using the tree) to left end of horizontal ledge 6 ft up. Traverse horizontal Right to the broad nose.    . . (variation: Instead stop traverse just before the nose, and join "Elmo's Leap" to go up staying left of nose).   Up the broad nose to top.

 name? Character from famous educational puppet show (and movies) started several decades ago. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.location:
Exactly below small tree 5 ft up, which is about 12 feet left from broad nose / vague ridge at the left end of very low roof. 

  - - > see on this Photo

content.description:
Fun strenuous sequence, but it's all over after the first eight feet. 

  Get past the roof to up on the broad nose -- perhaps easier to start a few feet right -- or harder and more interesting to start even farther right. Then join "Miss Piggy" and finish up the nose.  

  name? Character from famous educational puppet show (and movies) started several decades ago. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Sustained interesting climbing at the 5.7-8 level, but one move (about eight feet up) much harder than the others. 

  Roughly straight up the face, finishing 5 feet right of arete and 3 feet left of short vertical groove with tiny overhang near its top. 

  name? 1937 Disney movie : non-tall climbing route. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.location:
Find the ridge / arete with a left-trending diagonal crack across its bottom -- in the left half of the sector, not so far from the left end of the sector. See the 2-foot-wide gully between that arete and the maple tree to the right. Start on the face between the arete and the gully. 

  - - >  See on this Photo

  . . . . or on this Photo

content.description:
A couple moves much harder than the rest. 

  Reachy? Likely much more difficult for a climber less tall than 5ft 6inch with normal reach. 

  Start on face to right of gully and about eight feet left of maple tree. (without using gully) Go roughly straight up to finish left of cliff top tree. 

  name? Fictional dwarf 1937 Disney movie. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:
Fun climbing, but since it slants so much, not so good for top-roping. 

  Start up the 2-foot-wide gully, then follow ramp / groove / crack trending way right. 

  name? Alternate handle for one of seven dwarfs - (why not "dwarves"?). 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree).

content.description:
Delicate on small holds -- but only 1 or 2 harder moves. 

  Reachy? Might be much more difficult for a climber less tall than 5ft 6inch with normal reach. 

  Start 6-8 feet left of obvious vertical crack (same handhold as route adjacent to left), then climb w feet and hands on the face left of the crack or in the crack. 

  name? Fictional dwarf 1937 Disney movie. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree). 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).

content.description:

  Up onto the tree (using the tree), then up rock face to top.

content.description:
Variety of moves at or near the difficulty grade. Too bad it's not longer. 

  Start on right side of the arete, follow diagonal crack / ramp around to Left side, and up left side to top. 

  name? Fictional dwarf 1937 Disney movie. 

warning: The rock on and around this route has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber - (and if possible, behind a large tree).

content.description:
Wide but not only 20-25 feet tall.   . . . (So the obvious strategy is to set up a static line (or two) for top-roping several lines closely spaced). 

  Mostly less-than-vertical face climbing with thoughtful moves.   . . . (Perhaps some other styles to the right of the "crazy" tree?) 

  Named for a tree with an extra trunk growing sideways out of the rock face. 

  Right side is adjacent to The Shelves sector of the Books Tier area). 

Top-Rope: Lots of trees above the cliff might be useful as anchors for a static line. Top of cliff can be reached with easy scrambling up around its left side. 

warning: The rock around this sector has not been climbed much yet, and much of the rock is still breakable and loose -- so the belayer and other people should stand far away from underneath the climber. 

  . . . (Lots of vegetation on this rock as of 2016. Be prepared when climbing to navigate around protruding trees and branches, and dealing with holds slippery with grass, lichen, moss, dirt).
